titleStmt.title: Commonwealth of Kentucky v. Daniel Cook, Indictment
CWG10849

availability.p: This image and transcription is publicly accessible. The image appears courtesy of the repository named in the Source Description. The transcription and annotation were undertaken by Kentucky Historical Society staff, volunteers, and interns. If referencing this document title, accession number, and permanent URL.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition
Early Access

msIdentifier.repository: Kentucky Department for Libraries and Archives
msIdentifier.collection: Office of the Governor, Beriah Magoffin: Governor's Official Correspondence File, Petitions for Pardons and Remissions, 1859-1862

body.p:
Hancock Circuit Court
August term 1859.
The Commonwealth of Kentucky
against
Daniel Cook

The grand Jury of Hancock County in the name and by the authority of the Commonwealth of Kentucky accuse Daniel Cook of the offence of unlawfully. Shooting at another with intent to kill or wound such person without inflicting a wound. Committed as follows. viz: the Said Daniel Cook on the 20th day of August 1859, in the County aforesaid, did unlawfully Shoot at one. Hutchinson with intent to kill or wound him the Said Hutchinson but without inflicting a wound on him the Said Hutchinson: the Said offence being done against the peace and at dignity of the Commonwealth of Kentucky,
Cicero Maxwell attorney for the Commonwealth
Information given by Erastus Sandford & Robert A Higdon.

Summons for Commonwealth,
Abraham Callinder,
Tilman H Radford.,
James Conner.
Richard Harding,

A Copy Attest
Jas E Slone clk H C C

Hancock Cir Ct
$100. } Recog
Jno. C. Thomas & others
Remission Issd Sept. 12. 1861
